results.title: A Unicorn Lost in the Valley, Evernote Blows Up the ‘Fail Fast’ Gospel
results.abstract: In this season of multibillion-dollar I.P.O.s, the 15-year-old start-up is proving that failure, for companies of a certain size, rarely happens abruptly.

multimedia.caption: As chief executive, Chris O’Neill laid off employees, scaled back side projects, canceled lavish perks (like a weekly sushi lunch and free house cleaners), shuttered three international offices, and hiked the price of an Evernote subscription. He left the company last year.

results.title: The Government Cut Their Internet. Will Abuses Now Remain Hidden?

results.title: Man Is Charged in Twitter Threat to Lynch Muslim Lawyer

results.title: A Comprehensive Guide to Taking Your Smartphone Abroad for Cheap
results.abstract: For $15 to $40, you can easily take your phone to a foreign country and enjoy access to apps, maps and the web. But it takes a lot of steps, hence this travel guide.
